sense.gloss: missing (meeting) each other, failing to meet
to pass (by) each other, to brush past
to miss (meeting) each other, to fail to meet
to be at odds, to clash, to be in conflict
comparing and adjusting, reconciling, knocking into shape, bouncing of ideas, opinions, etc. off each other to obtain a fine-tuned integrated whole
lapping, precision surface finishing, mating by rubbing together
chafing, sore, scrape, scratch, mark, rub, rubbing together, blister
x: 世間擦れ・せけんずれ

sense.gloss: grazing, skimming, almost touching, passing within inches, being within a whisker, shaving close
barely, just, narrowly, by a slim margin
shoe sore, foot blister (caused by shoes)

sdata.j: ↑靴↑↓くつ↓がすっかり↑擦↑↓す↓り↑減↑↓へ↓った。
よく↑使↑↓つか↓ったのでこのバッグは↑擦↑↓す↓り↑切↑↓き↓れた。
sdata.e: Hard use has worn this bag.

sdata.j: タイヤはゴムと↑路面↑↓ろめん↓の↑摩擦↑↓まさつ↓によってすり↑減↑↓へ↓る。
sdata.e: Tires wear down because of friction between the rubber and the road surface.

sdata.j: その↑皮↑↓かわ↓↑製↑↓せい↓の↑上着↑↓うわぎ↓の↑両↑↓りょう↓↑肘↑↓ひじ↓↑部分↑↓ぶぶん↓が↑擦↑↓こす↓り↑減↑↓べ↓って↑穴↑↓あな↓が↑空↑↓あ↓いた。
sdata.e: The leather jacket has worn out at the elbows.

sdata.j: その↑革↑↓かわ↓↑製↑↓せい↓の↑上着↑↓うわぎ↓の↑両↑↓りょう↓↑肘↑↓ひじ↓の↑部分↑↓ぶぶん↓が↑擦↑↓こす↓り↑減↑↓べ↓って↑穴↑↓あな↓があいた。
sdata.e: The leather jacket has worn out at the elbow.

sdata.j: この↑擦↑↓す↓り↑切↑↓き↓れたカーペットを↑取↑↓と↓り↑除↑↓のぞ↓かねばならないでしょう。
sdata.e: I will have to get rid of this worn-out carpet.

sdata.j: ケリーはマッチを↑擦↑↓こす↓ってパイプへもっていった。
sdata.e: Kelly struck a match and put it to his pipe.

sdata.j: お↑前↑↓まえ↓の↑鼻↑↓はな↓をクソに↑擦↑↓こす↓りつけてやった。
sdata.e: I sure rubbed your nose in shit.

sdata.j: いわゆる↑貿易↑↓ぼうえき↓↑摩擦↑↓まさつ↓はいつの↑日↑↓ひ↓か↑避↑↓さ↓けることができよう。
sdata.e: So-called trade friction could be avoided some day.

sdata.j: ↑現在↑↓げんざい↓の↑日↑↓にち↓↑米↑↓べい↓↑貿易↑↓ぼうえき↓↑摩擦↑↓まさつ↓の↑原因↑↓げんいん↓は↑何↑↓なん↓であると↑思↑↓おも↓いますか。
sdata.e: What do you think has caused the present trade friction between Japan and the U.S.?

words.gloss: to pass (by) each other, to brush past
